key_mistakes.reason: Moving the queen early exposed it to attack without gain, and it did not contribute to development.
This move weakened the pawn structure and did not address the threats on the board.
Recapturing with the rook instead of the knight allowed the opponent to maintain significant material advantage.

recommendations: Avoid moving the queen early in the game unless it provides a clear advantage or threat.
Focus on developing minor pieces and controlling the center before making pawn moves that could weaken your structure.
Be cautious with recaptures, especially when they result in a significant loss of material.
